TEXT.English: [TAB]During the Italian Risorgimento, the volunteers who followed Giuseppe Garibaldi in southern Italy were called Redshirts (Camicie rosse) because of the colour of their shirts (complete uniforms were beyond the finances of the Italian patriots). They were also called i Mille ("the thousand"), because that was the number that first set off with Garibaldi from Genoa.
